intro: Diplostephium juliani, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
